title: Why the Michelin Guide UK 2020 has lost its taste for fashion - and awards more stars to classic French cuisine
text:
Monday night’s Michelin Stars Revelation 2020, streamed live on Facebook from the Hurlingham Club in West London, was the standard spectacle of watch-through-the-fingers awkwardness from Le Guide Rouge.

The worthy speeches, the clunky direction, the interminable wait for it to just get going already. How I yearn for the days when they’d simply send out a press release, and even more so for the times when the results were leaked beforehand. Now that was exciting.

But this year, the results themselves were different. For after a few years of trying to look ‘with it’ by awarding of-the-moment eateries characterised by cool concepts and concrete floors, the Michelin Guide (first published in 1900...
description: Monday night’s Michelin Stars Revelation 2020, streamed live on Facebook from the Hurlingham Club in West London, was the standard spectacle of watch-through-the-fingers awkwardness from Le Guide Rouge.
